page.title: 05LIFE OF ONE OLD MAN, HESSLE
page.content: George is 85. He has lived all his life in Hull. When he was 20 years old, he was a stoker on a trading ship. A stoker kept the fires clean in the boiler room and in working order so that they could fuel the boilers to power the ship. His ship visited Canada, USA,Argentina and Germany. He left the ship after 7 years and became a roadmender in Montreal to make money to return home. He did so on a ship called the "Empress of India". When he returned he obtained a job as a bricklayer and joiner in a firm called "Dave Smith of Hessle, Building Contractors". This was at the time of World War II and because of his trade he was made foreman of a Bomb Damage team, which helped repair houses when the bombs had hit them.
